ChangeMe

Creature
ItemSlotClass
ChangeMe

This is an example of the Base class that should be used for unique Creature implementations.  Any property or method call missing from here will negate the save/loading and upgrading system.

Summary
ChangeMeThis is an example of the Base class that should be used for unique Creature implementations.
Functions
ChangeMe
UpgradeVersion1This is an example method to upgrade a saved version of a ChangeMe creature from version 1 to version 2
UpgradeVersion2Second example for v2 to v3.

Functions

ChangeMe

public function ChangeMe(dataObject: Object = null)

UpgradeVersion1

protected function UpgradeVersion1(dataObject: Object):void

This is an example method to upgrade a saved version of a ChangeMe creature from version 1 to version 2

Parameters

param dataObject The save object from the previous upgrade level.  (ie a dataObject at v1)

UpgradeVersion2

protected function UpgradeVersion2(dataObject: Object):void

Second example for v2 to v3.  New properties that are added between versions don’t have to go through the upgrade process, we can grab the “default” value as part of the initial class construction process.  As the data and associated property name aren’t in the dataObject, they won’t be overwritten!

Parameters

param dataObject
I cannot yet implement “smart” detection of which characters (or furthermore, what properties of which characters) actually need to be serialized, because the raw storage types used throughout the Creature class (f.ex Cocks Array) are not aware of their parent class.
